strategy: Implement a stacking regression model by combining predictions from multiple algorithms including Linear Regression, Decision Tree Regressor, and Support Vector Machine regressor.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, KFold
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
from sklearn.svm import SVR
from sklearn.ensemble import StackingRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)
X_test.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)

# Separate numerical and categorical features
numerical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns.tolist()
categorical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Define preprocessing steps
numeric_transformer = StandardScaler()

preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', numeric_transformer, numerical_features)
    ])

# Define base models
linear_model = LinearRegression()
tree_model = DecisionTreeRegressor(random_state=42)
svm_model = SVR(kernel='rbf')

# Create stacking regressor
stacking_regressor = StackingRegressor(
    estimators=[('lr', linear_model), ('dt', tree_model), ('svm', svm_model)],
    final_estimator=LinearRegression()
)

# Train the stacking regressor
stacking_regressor.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_stacking = stacking_regressor.predict(X_train)

# Calculate RMSE
rmse = mean_squared_error(y_train, y_pred_stacking, squared=False)
print(f"RMSE: {rmse}")

# Make predictions on test set
test_predictions = stacking_regressor.predict(X_test)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': test_predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

X_test.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
from sklearn.svm import SVR
from sklearn.ensemble import StackingRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)
X_test.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)

# Separate numerical and categorical features
numerical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns.tolist()
categorical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Define preprocessing steps
numeric_transformer = StandardScaler()

preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', numeric_transformer, numerical_features)
    ])

# Define base models
linear_model = LinearRegression()
tree_model = DecisionTreeRegressor(random_state=42)
svm_model = SVR(kernel='rbf')

# Create stacking regressor
stacking_regressor = StackingRegressor(
    estimators=[('lr', linear_model), ('dt', tree_model), ('svm', svm_model)],
    final_estimator=LinearRegression()
)

# Train the stacking regressor
stacking_regressor.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set

# Calculate RMSE

# Make predictions on test set

# Save submission

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
from sklearn.svm import SVR
from sklearn.ensemble import StackingRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)
X_test.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)

# Separate numerical and categorical features
numerical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns.tolist()
categorical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Define preprocessing steps
numeric_transformer = StandardScaler()

preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', numeric_transformer, numerical_features)
    ])

# Define base models
linear_model = LinearRegression()
tree_model = DecisionTreeRegressor(random_state=42)
svm_model = SVR(kernel='rbf')

# Create stacking regressor
stacking_regressor = StackingRegressor(
    estimators=[('lr', linear_model), ('dt', tree_model), ('svm', svm_model)],
    final_estimator=LinearRegression()
)

# Train the stacking regressor
stacking_regressor.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_stacking = stacking_regressor.predict(X_train)

# Calculate RMSE
rmse = mean_squared_error(y_train, y_pred_stacking, squared=False)
print(f"RMSE: {rmse}")

# Make predictions on test set
test_predictions = stacking_regressor.predict(X_test)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': test_predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
from sklearn.svm import SVR
from sklearn.ensemble import StackingRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)
X_test.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)

# Separate numerical and categorical features
numerical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns.tolist()
categorical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Define preprocessing steps
numeric_transformer = StandardScaler()

preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', numeric_transformer, numerical_features)
    ])

# Define base models
linear_model = LinearRegression()
tree_model = DecisionTreeRegressor(random_state=42)
svm_model = SVR(kernel='rbf')

# Create stacking regressor
stacking_regressor = StackingRegressor(
    estimators=[('lr', linear_model), ('dt', tree_model), ('svm', svm_model)],
    final_estimator=LinearRegression()
)

# Train the stacking regressor
stacking_regressor.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_stacking = stacking_regressor.predict(X_train)

# Calculate RMSE
rmse = mean_squared_error(y_train, y_pred_stacking, squared=False)
print(f"RMSE: {rmse}")

# Make predictions on test set
test_predictions = stacking_regressor.predict(X_test)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': test_predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

X_test.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
from sklearn.svm import SVR
from sklearn.ensemble import StackingRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)
X_test.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)

# Separate numerical and categorical features
numerical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns.tolist()
categorical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Define preprocessing steps
numeric_transformer = StandardScaler()

preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', numeric_transformer, numerical_features)
    ])

# Define base models
linear_model = LinearRegression()
tree_model = DecisionTreeRegressor(random_state=42)
svm_model = SVR(kernel='rbf')

# Create stacking regressor
stacking_regressor = StackingRegressor(
    estimators=[('lr', linear_model), ('dt', tree_model), ('svm', svm_model)],
    final_estimator=LinearRegression()
)

# Train the stacking regressor
stacking_regressor.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_stacking = stacking_regressor.predict(X_train)

# Calculate RMSE
rmse = mean_squared_error(y_train, y_pred_stacking, squared=False)
print(f"RMSE: {rmse}")

# Make predictions on test set
test_predictions = stacking_regressor.predict(X_test)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': test_predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
